name: Ancient Greek Architecture Quiz | World Sites | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which two of the following collaborated on the construction of the Parthenon?
questions.explanation:
Kallikrates and Iktinos.

	Kallikrates and Iktinos along with Phidias were the architects who worked together around 438 BC on the Parthenon - which means 'apartment of the virgin' - reputedly the most perfect Doric temple ever built.

questions.text: The Athenian Treasury was located where during the time of the Delian League?
questions.explanation:
Delphi.

	A temple and storehouse built around 490 BC whose architect remains unknown, the Athenian Treasury was another fine example of Doric construction.

questions.text: In what architectural style was the Temple of Athena constructed?
questions.explanation:
Doric.

	Near the gateway to the Acropolis is the Temple of Athena Nike which was built around 427 BC and is a wonderful example of Ancient Greek architecture.

questions.text: The first known Corinthian column capital was seen in the construction of which temple?
questions.explanation:
The Temple of Apollo.

	Around 415 BC the Temple of Apollo Epicurius was built using Doric, Ionic and Corinthian columns.

questions.text: Is the Erechtheion to the north, south, east or west of the Parthenon?
questions.explanation:
North & north.

	The Erechtheion, an Ionic temple with a Caryatid porch, stands on the Acropolis to the north of the Parthenon.  It was built around 420 BC.

questions.text: Which of the following, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, was burnt to the ground?
questions.explanation:
The Temple of Artemis.

	Burnt down in 356 BC by Herostratos, the Temple of Artemis which was built around 550 BC, was rebuilt in exactly the same place in the Ionic style.

questions.text: Converted into a church during the Byzantine period was which of the following temples, built in the Doric style?
questions.explanation:
The Temple of Hephaestus.

	Begun in 449 BC, the Temple of Hephaestus remains well preserved to this day.  Built almost entirely of marble, it is also known as The Theseion.

questions.text: Which amphitheatre is Polykleitos credited with building?
questions.explanation:
The Theatre at Epidauros.

	Constructed around 300 BC, the Theatre at Epidauros is reputedly a 'perfect' example of the classic amphitheatre.

questions.text: What type of building was the Stoa of Attalus?
questions.explanation:
A shopping mall.

	The Stoa of Attalus, 'the mall' was a two storey building with both Doric and Ionic columns built around 150 BC.

questions.text: Of what materials was the statue of Athena that stood in the Parthenon made?
questions.explanation:
Ivory and Gold.

	The statue of Athena Parthenos was created by Phidias and showed Athena fully armed with her spear and helmet.
